author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Special Court for CBI Cases here on Friday awarded three years rigorous imprisonment to a central excise superintendent and wife in a disproportionate asset case filed by Central Bureau of Investigations (CBI).

In his judgement the Additional District Judge–II and Special Judge for CBI Cases N. Muralidharan ordered that their fixed deposit of Rs. 18 lakh be confiscated. He slapped a fine of Rs. 10,000 each on them.

The case was registered by the Anti Corruption Branch of CBI, Chennai, in 2007. The case was that K. Subramani, the then Assistant Commissioner of Central Excise, had acquired assets in his name and that of wife Kasthuri between January 2003 and October 2007 disproportionate to their known sources of income.

The couple was booked under sections 109 (punishment of abetment is same as crime has been done) of the Indian Penal Code read with sections 13(2) read with 13(1)(e) of the Prevention of Corruption Act. Trial in the case was conducted by the II – Additional District Judge and Special Judge for CBI Cases, Coimbatore, who pronounced the judgement on Friday.
title: RI for Excise official, wife
